channel.title: Xbox 360 Zune
channel.description: So I just wanted to know if I could stream a movie on XBL Zune 1080p without downloading. My connection is pretty shitty though, 1.5mbps dl. Will I have many problems? [Or should I just download it?]

item.title: Xbox 360 Zune
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“sup000, post:7, topic:331263”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=427621.msg3141404#msg3141404 date=1267569606]
Sanga i sure hope that not all of your movies are that big. All of my 1080p movies are 4gb. If you want proof ill pm it.
[/quote]

[quote]
Source…: Blu Ray
[/quote][/quote]

Good one you twat. Of course the source is bluray along with ever other bluray rip that exists. It doesn’t matter if he downloaded it or if he owns the movie. Thats a file. All of my sources are bluray also expcet for maybe 2 hd dvds. But they are still under or at 4gb. Regular bluray movies are 38GB.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Zune
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:2, topic:331263”]lol at streaming 1080p on1.5mbit
this is from one of my 720p films

[quote]Release…: 2008.11.27
Size…: 6.55 gigs
Source…: Blu Ray
Video specs…: x264 @ 6900 kbps
Audio specs…: English 5.1

  • –> dts/1500bps
    Subtitles…: English (forced)
    Runtime…: 111 min 40 sec[/quote]
    thats almost 7mbit just on the video and thats not even 1080p, good luck though[/quote]

What? The video codec they use is optimized for streaming live video. So it’s not nearly that large of a file size.

Read full topic

item.description:

Release......: 2008.11.27 Size.........: 6.55 gigs Source.......: Blu Ray Video specs..: x264 @ 6900 kbps Audio specs..: English 5.1 - --> dts/1500bps Subtitles....: English (forced) Runtime......: 111 min 40 sec
thats almost 7mbit just on the video and thats not even 1080p, good luck though
